com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.io

Class HighPerformanceLogFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.io.HighPerformanceLogFileSystem

  • public final class HighPerformanceLogFileSystem
extends Object
    Simple file system like view of the log files in a directory.

    This class is intentionally not thread safe as:

    • It is cheap to create
    • It does not modify the underlying file system in any way.

    There should be an instance of this class used per thread should multi-threaded usage by required.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HighPerformanceLogFileSystem.EventLocationDescriptor
      Class used to hand back event location details to callers of findFirstEvent(long).
      static class  HighPerformanceLogFileSystem.LastEventTimestampData
      Container class to hold log event timestamp and timestamp count information.

      • getTimestampOfFirstEvent

        public long getTimestampOfFirstEvent()
        Extracts the timestamp of the first event in the first file (if any). If there are no files then 0 is returned.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the first event in the first file or 0 if no files exist.

      • getLastEventTimestampData

        public HighPerformanceLogFileSystem.LastEventTimestampData getLastEventTimestampData()
        Reads the last event in the logs and reads the events backwards from the last event to determine how many events of this timestamp exist. The function continues to reads backwards through the logs, crossing files until it reaches an event with a timestamp different from the last one.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the last event and the number of events with this timestamp.

      • findFileContainingEvent

        public File findFileContainingEvent(long timestamp,
                                    long offset)
        Find the file (if any) containing the log event with the specified timestamp at the specified file offset.

        This operation incurs the costs of a single search (i.e. open, seek, read) for each available log file and so is O(N) with the number of log files present.

        Parameters:
        timestamp - The event timestamp.
        offset - The file offset.
        Returns:
        The file containing the required event, null if the required event cannot be found in any log file.
        See Also:
        HighPerformanceLogFileReader

      • findFirstEvent

        public HighPerformanceLogFileSystem.EventLocationDescriptor findFirstEvent(long timestamp)
        Find the first log file event (if any) with a timestamp ≥ the specified timestamp.

        This operation is potentially very expensive as all available events up to the first matching event must be read in and checked. It is designed to be used as a fallback in case no offset is available, usually because of an operational error. Prefer findFileContainingEvent(long, long) if a known offset is available.

        Parameters:
        timestamp - The event timestamp.
        Returns:
        The log event location descriptor or null if no matching event was found.
        See Also:
        HighPerformanceLogFileReader, findFileContainingEvent(long, long)

      • findNthEventFromEnd

        public HighPerformanceLogFileSystem.EventLocationDescriptor findNthEventFromEnd(int n)
                                                                         throws IOException
        Returns the coordinates of the nth event from the end of the log.

        If there are less than n events in the log, the coordinates of the first event are returned.

        Parameters:
        n - nth event
        Returns:
        coordinates of the nth event from the end of the log, or the coordinates of the first event if there are less than n events in the log, or null if the log is empty
        Throws:
        IOException - if error occurs while reading log files
